member.summary: Creates SSL stream. and authenticates client.

member.summary: Sends the text command to server. Adds "\r\n" to the command.

member.summary: Reads data from server until gets "\r\n" string.

member.summary: Derived classes should overide this method to perform specific closing action.

member.summary: Equal to calling 'Close(false);'.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.TcpTextClient.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs method Closes Connection
member.exception: Socket errors (only if 'throwExceptions==true'). Closes connection anyway.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3
member.summary: Class used for connecting to POP3 server. It allows downloading, deleting emails and so on.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.User
member.summary: User name.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.Password
member.summary: User's password.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.timeStampParser
member.summary: For parsing server's greeting in order to retrive timestamp value. Used by GetTimeStamp.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.timeStamp
member.summary: RFC 1939: A POP3 server which implements the APOP command will include a timestamp in its banner greeting. The syntax of the timestamp corresponds to the `msg-id' in [RFC822] ("<12214.123@ad12>") Filled by Connect method.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.ProgressThreshold
member.summary: Says how often ReceiveProgress event will be raised. In bytes.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.messageCount
member.summary: Number of messages on server.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.mailboxSize
member.summary: Size of the mail massages on server in octets.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.SetStreams
member.summary: Creates new Reader and Writer objects. With specified encoding. Reader: Default Encoding; Writer: ASCII Encoding.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new Pop3 client object. Sets ReceiveTimeout to 5 sec.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.GetTimeStamp(System.String)
member.summary: Parses response - get's timestamp if any, and fills timeStamp property. If there is no timestamp, timeStamp remains unchaged.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.GetServerGreeting
member.summary: Receives server's greeting. Get's timestamp.

member.summary: Connects to POP3 server on port 110.

member.summary: Connects to POP3 server using SSL port 995.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.STLS
member.summary: Sends 'STLS' command and initializes SSL connection.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.SendCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends command which expects to recive single-line response e.g. "STAT".
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response (if 'throwException' param is set to true).
member.remarks: Some commands have their own specialized methods in this class, you should probably use them insted.
member.param: If true throws ServerException on -ERR response

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.SendCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Sends command which expects to recive single-line response e.g. "STAT".
member.remarks: Some commands have their own specialized methods in this class, you should probably use them insted. This is equal to 'SendCommand(command,true);'.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.SendMultiLineCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends command which expects to recive multi-line response e.g. "RETR".
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response (if 'throwException' param is set to true).
member.remarks: Some commands have their own specialized methods in this class, you should probably use them insted.
member.param: If true throws ServerException on -ERR response

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.SendMultiLineCommnad(System.String)
member.summary: Sends command which expects to recive multi-line response e.g. "RETR".
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response (if 'throwException' param is set to true).
member.remarks: Some commands have their own specialized methods in this class, you should probably use them insted. This is equal to 'SendMultiLineCommand(command,true);'.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.OnReceiveProgress(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Raises the ReceiveProgress event.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.ReceiveMultiLine
member.summary: Recives mult-line response from server.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.Login
member.summary: Logs user in using USER, PASS commands. Uses and properties. This method sends the password in clear text.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.APOPLogin
member.summary: Logs user in using APOP command. Uses and properties. This method does NOT send the password in clear text.
member.remarks: APOP is optional command and a POP3 server does NOT need to support it. A POP3 server which implements the APOP command will include a timestamp in its banner greeting. Check property in order to know if server included the timestamp. Some servers include timestamp, but do NOT support APOP command. This command is unnessesary if you are using SSL, use method instead.
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response. Throws ServerException when there is no timestamp (==false).

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.GetAccountStat
member.summary: Gets stat information from server. Fills and property.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.DeleteMessage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks specified message for deletion. The POP3 server does not actually delete the message until the POP3 session enters the UPDATE state - succesful QUIT command.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.GetMessageHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets specified mail message containing only headers.
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response or corrupted response.
member.param: Number of message to get (starts from 1)
member.returns: String containing mail message which contains only headers.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.GetMessage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets specified mail message form server.
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response or corrupted response.
member.param: Number of message to get (starts from 1)

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.ListUniqueID
member.summary: Sends UIDL command to the pop3 server. Returns a key value collection. Keys are message numbers (starting from 1) value is a unique-id of the message.
member.returns: Key value collection, with message number as key and unique-id as a value

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.ListUniqueID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends UIDL command to the pop3 server. Returns line with the unique-id for that message.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.ListSize
member.summary: Returns the size (in bytes) of every message in bytes. Returns a key value collection. Keys are message numbers (starting from 1) value is size of the message.
member.returns: Key value collection, with message number as key and size as a value

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.ListSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the size (in bytes) of specified message in bytes.
member.param: Number of message to get (starts from 1)

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3.CloseCommand
member.summary: Sends the Quit command. And gets server response.
member.exception: Throws ServerException on -ERR response on Quit command

member.summary: True if there was a timestamp in server's greeting (usually it means that APOP command is supported, but not always). Filled by Connect method.

member.summary: Number of messages on server. Filled by .

member.summary: Size of the mail massages on server in octets. Filled by .

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Client.Pop3MultiLineResponse.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Replaces "
.." with "
." (RFC 1939). Removes 5 last chars ("
.
"). Runs base.Parse method.

member.summary: Creates new MailBox object. Fills and properties.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MailBox.#ctor
M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MailBox.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses s, and creates new MailBox object. Replaces escape sequences in mailbox's display-name, and decodes Quoted-Printable and Base64 fragments.
member.param:
String to parse.
Format:
"name" <address>
name <address>
<address> //name==null
address //name==null
member.returns: New MailBox object or null if s==null.

member.summary: Returns string containing only Name if it exists or Address
member.returns: Name if it exists or Address

member.summary: Parses s, and creates new MailBoxList object. Replaces escape sequences in mailbox's display-name, and decodes Quoted-Printable and Base64 fragments.

String to parse.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDisposition
member.summary: Types of actions which mail user agent should take to present the specified data to the user. It simply says what you should do with the data. (RFC 2183)

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDisposition.Inline
member.summary: Data should be displayed to the user.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDisposition.Attachment
member.summary: This is attachment.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDisposition.None
member.summary: Content-disposition field is not present. Mail user agent may use whatever presentation method it deems suitable (RFC 2183).

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDisposition.Other
member.summary: Unknown Content-disposition type. Unrecognized disposition types should be treated as `attachment' (RFC 2183).

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Class implementing header's 'content-disposition' field (RFC 2183). Giving simple access to disposition name as string and as enum, and all other options.

member.summary: Disposition of content.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentDisposition.DispositionName
member.summary: 'Content-disposition' name. Null only if =='MimeDisposition.None'.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentDisposition.FileName
member.summary: ContentDisposition's filename parameter, suggested filename. May be null.
member.remarks: It is important that you should not blindly use the suggested filename. The suggested filename SHOULD be checked (and possibly changed) to see that it conforms to local filesystem conventions, does not overwrite an existing file, and does not present a security problem.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentDisposition.Options
member.summary: All options. Null only if =='MimeDisposition.None'.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentType
member.summary: Class implementing header's 'content-type' field (RFC 2045). Giving simple access to type/subtype properties as strings and as enum ('type', 'subtype' property), and all other options.
member.remarks: Messages without a MIME Content-Type header are taken to be plain text in the US-ASCII character set, which can be explicitly specified as: Content-type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii Each part in "multipart/digest" has a default type of "message/rfc822".

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentType.MimeType
member.summary: Type of content.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentType.MimeSubtype
member.summary: Subype of content.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentType.TypeName
member.summary: Type name of content. Always in lower case. May be null.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentType.SubtypeName
member.summary: Subtype name of content. Always in lower case. May be null.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.ContentType.Options
member.summary: All options.

member.summary: Creates new ContentType object describing 'mimeBase'.

member.summary: Returns +'/'+ properties or "none/none" if it's null.

member.summary: Decodes Base64 and Quoted-Printable strings (RFC 2047).
member.exception: The charset is not supported by the current regional options of the computer executing this method.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.HeaderCoding.RemoveComments(System.String)
member.summary: Some header fields can contain comments - text between 2 parentheses '(' , ')'. This method removes comments from specified string.

member.summary: Replaces escape sequences in specified string. E.g. changes '\?' -> '?'.
member.param: String with escape sequences to replace.

member.summary: For strings "iso-8859-2"

member.summary: Object representing mail's body.

member.summary:

and properties.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MailMessage.ParseDate(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the date.

list.item: "ddd, %d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT" //incompatible with RFC 2822,
"ddd, %d MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss UT" //incompatible with RFC 2822,
"ddd, %d MMM yyyy HH:mm GMT" //incompatible with RFC 2822,
"ddd, %d MMM yyyy HH:mm UT" //incompatible with RFC 2822,
"ddd, MMM %d yyyy HH:mm:ss zzzz" //incompatible with RFC 2822, but used by MsPassport,

member.summary: Mail's subject. May be null.

member.summary: 'From' field. Specifies the author(s) of the message. If empty, email-message is NOT RFC 2822 compliant.

member.summary: 'Sender' field. Specifies the mailbox of the agent responsible for the actual transmission. May be null.

member.summary: 'Reply-to' field. Mailbox(es) to which the author of the message suggests that replies be sent. May be empty.

member.summary: 'To' field. Contains the address(es) of the primary recipient(s) of the message. May be empty.

member.summary: 'Cc' field (Carbon copy). Addresses of others who are to receive the message, tough the content of the message may not be directed at them. May be empty.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.MailMessage.Bcc
member.summary: 'Bcc' field (Blind Carbon copy). Addresses of others who are to receive the message, tough the content of the message may not be directed at them. May be empty.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase
member.summary: Class for basic mime entity parsing. All mime classes, created by MimeFactory inherit from this class.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.mailMessage
member.summary: Mail message object to which this object belongs.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.unfoldParse
member.summary: For unfolding: "param: very long\r\n value" in to "param: very long value" (RFC 2822) Used by constructor.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.headersParse
member.summary: For extracting param and value. Used by ParseHeaders. (RFC 2822) field = field-name ":" field-body CRLF field-name = 1*<any printable char (33-126, HEX 21-7E) excluding ":" (HEX 3A)> field-body = 1*<any char excluding CR and LF> //"unstructured" Used by ParseHeaders

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.optionsParse
member.summary: For extracting multiple options from single entry. Used by GetOptions.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.ContentType
member.summary: Content type of the body.
member.remarks: Content-type "text/plain" should be assumed if there is no ContentType (none/none) or it is unknown.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.body
member.summary: Body of the mime entity. This property may contain unprintable chars (e.g. if 'content-type: application/x-zip-compressed').

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.Headers
member.summary: Collection of mime headers. Keys are always in lower case.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.#ctor(System.String,Lesnikowski.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Creates new MimeBase object from string. Creates and fills property. Fills property.
member.remarks: Content-type "text/plain" should be assumed if there is no ContentType (none/none) or it is unknown.
member.param: Object to which MimeBase should belong.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Lesnikowski.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Creates new MimeBase object from string. Creates and fills property. Fills property.
member.remarks: Content-type "text/plain" should be assumed if there is no ContentType (none/none) or it is unknown.
member.param: Object to which MimeBase should belong.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Copies references to all properties from source object.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.ParseHeaders(System.String)
member.summary: Unfolds headerString (RFC 2822). Fills property.
member.param: String containing headers. With last "\r\n" included.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.GetOptions(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates new StringOptions object. Fills it with options from 'headers[name]' string. Removes comments.
member.remarks:
e.g.: 'content-type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-2"; (comment) a=b'
Key: Value:
content-type text/plain
charset iso-8859-2
a b
member.param: Key value for option string in headers property.
If true all keys in returned object will be converted to lower case.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.ErrorList
member.summary: List conatining all errors encountered during parsing for MailMessage object to which this object belongs.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase.Body
member.summary: Body of the mime entity. This property may contain unprintable chars (e.g. if 'content-type: application/x-zip-compressed').

member.summary: of objects.

member.summary: Adds mime object to the end of the collection.

member.summary: Adds objectes from mimeList to the end of the collection.

member.summary: Flag indicating, if encoding was changed, and Data field is available. First access to Body or Data field set this flag to true.

member.summary: Byte array containing data.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeData.FileName
member.summary: Sugested file name. May be null.
member.remarks: It is important that you should not blindly use the suggested filename. The suggested filename SHOULD be checked (and possibly changed) to see that it conforms to local filesystem conventions, does not overwrite an existing file, and does not present a security problem.

member.summary: 'Content-Disposition' of the data. This object provides information on what you should do with the data.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeData.ContentId
member.summary: Content-ID of this entity. Without enclosing '<' and '>'.
member.remarks: E.g. 01@mobile

member.summary: Fills property.

member.summary: Creates new file with the specified name and saves to it.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeData.DecodeContentId(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes "cid" in URL ('a%25b@c') method returns. corresponding Content-ID message header ('a%b@c'). Converts %hh hex- escaped characters to their ASCII equivalents.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeData.GetContentId(System.String)
member.summary: If url is "cid" URL ('cid:a%25b@c') method returns. corresponding Content-ID message header ('a%b@c').
member.remarks: Converts %hh hex- escaped characters to their ASCII equivalents.
member.returns: Content-ID message header or null if url is NOT "cid" URL.

member.summary: Body of the mime entity. This property may contain unprintable chars (e.g. if 'content-type: application/x-zip-compressed').

member.summary: Byte array containing data received from server. No charset decoding was applied to this array.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMultipart
member.summary: Class implementing 'Multipart/?' mime entity.
member.remarks: There are specialized classes for diffrent subtypes which derive from this class.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMultipart.Parts
member.summary: Parts of the etity. In 'Multipart/?' e-mail parts are separated by boundary delimiter ( property).

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMultipart.Boundary
member.summary: Boundary delimiter. String which is separating parts of the Multipart entity. It already contains additional '--' at the beggining. E.g. '------=_NextPart_000_0020_01C36F64.F2562350'.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMultipart.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Creates new object from MimeBase object. Runs base (MimeBase) constructor. Creates and fills collection.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMultipart.ToString
member.summary: Returns string describing this entity.

member.summary: Class implementing 'Multipart/Mixed' mime entity. E.g. Mail with attachments.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMixed.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Runs base (MimeMultipart) constructor.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeMixed.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object with set to "Multipart/Mixed"

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeAlternative
member.summary: Class implementing 'Multipart/Alternative' mime entity. E.g. E-mail containing 'Text/HTML' and 'Text/Plain' representations of the same information. (RFC2046)

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeAlternative.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Creates new MimeAlternative object from MimeBase object. Runs base (MimeMultipart) constructor.

member.summary: Creates new object with set to "Multipart/Alternative"

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeAlternative.GetSimpliestData
member.summary: Gets simpliest data representation.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeAlternative.GetBestData
member.summary: Gets most complicated data representation.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeRelated
member.summary: Class implementing 'Multipart/Related' mime entity; E.g. HTML e-mail with embedded pictures; (RFC 2387).

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeRelated.Root
member.summary: Root mime object. This element should be process first. The 'parts' collection does NOT contain this element.
member.remarks: E.g. if E-mail is HTML e-mail with embedded picures, root will contain html body. All images will be placed in the 'parts' collection.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeRelated.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Creates new MimeRelated object from MimeBase object. Runs base (MimeMultipart) constructor. Finds root element, removes it from 'parts' collection and places it in 'root' propery.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeRelated.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object with set to "Multipart/Related"

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeRelated.ToString
member.summary: Returns string describing this entity.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDigest
member.summary: Class implementing 'Multipart/Digest' mime entity (RFC 2046). E.g. multiple mail messages.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDigest.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Runs base (MimeMultipart) constructor. Sets default Content-Type for each part to "Message/rfc822".

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeDigest.GetMailMessage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates new MailMessage object from specified part in collection. If Content-Type for specified part is different than "message/rfc822" it returns null.
member.returns: New MailMessage object or null if Content-Type for specified part is different than "message/rfc822".

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeReport
member.summary: Class implementing 'Multipart/Digest' mime entity (RFC 3462). E.g. multiple mail messages.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeReport.reportType
member.summary: [Required] Type of report.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeReport.description
member.summary: [Required] Human readable description of error. It may be in any MIME standards-track content-type, charset, or language. Where a description of the erroris desired in several languages or several media, a Multipart/Alternative construct may be used.(RFC 3462)

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeReport.status
member.summary: [Required] A machine parsable body part containing an account of the reported message handling event.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeReport.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Runs base (MimeMultipart) constructor. Fills and properties.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeReport.GetMailMessage
member.summary: Creates new MailMessage object from parts[3] in collection.
member.returns: New MailMessage object or null if ther was no attached mail message.

member.summary: MailMessage object containing real e-mail structure.

member.summary: Mail's subject. May be null.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.From
member.summary: Specifies the author(s) of the message. If empty mail-message is NOT RFC 2822 compliant.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.Sender
member.summary: Specifies the mailbox of the agent responsible for the actual transmission. May be null.

member.summary: Mailbox(es) to which the author of the message suggests that replies be sent. May be empty.

member.summary: Contains the address(es) of the primary recipient(s) of the message. May be empty.

member.summary: Addresses of others who are to receive the message, tough the content of the message may not be directed at them. May be empty.

member.summary: Blind Carbon copy.

member.summary: Mail's Importance

member.summary: Mail's Importance

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.TextData
member.summary: Object representing 'text/plain' body. Null if not present.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.HtmlData
member.summary: Object representing 'text/html' body. Null if not present.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.Attachments
member.summary: List of all attachment objects.

member.name: F:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.Visuals
member.summary: List of all visual elements. Iterate through this collection to find picture embedded in html body with specifed content-id ('content-id' header field).

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.ProcessData(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeData)
member.summary: If contentDisposition of 'mime' object is: 'inline' or 'none': if 'type' is 'text/html' or 'none': textData property is filled with it. if 'type' is 'text/plain': htmlData property is filled with it. else: object is added to 'visuals' collection. 'attachment': object is added to 'attachments' collection.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.ProcessMime(Lesnikowski.Mail.MimeBase)
member.summary: Process 'mime' object and all its children recursively. Runs 'ProcessData' if 'mime' is 'MimeData' object.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.#ctor(Lesnikowski.Mail.MailMessage)
member.summary: Creates new SimpleMailMessage object.
member.remarks: It does NOT copy 'mail' parameter, so you should NOT use it after creating the object. Process 'mail.mime' object recursively.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new SimpleMailMessage object from string.
member.remarks: Creates internal object from 'mailString' parameter.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.ParseHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new SimpleMailMessage object (containing only headers and MailBase type object in Mail.Mime field) from string.
member.remarks: Creates internal object from 'mailString' parameter.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.ToString
member.summary: Returns string describing this message.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.TextDataString
member.summary: Plain text data.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.SimpleMailMessage.HtmlDataString
member.summary: Html data.

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding
member.summary: Class allowing 'Base64' and 'QuotedPrintable' string decoding.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.GetEscapedHexString(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Decodes escaped chars from hex. Changes 3 chars '[escape]A9' into one char with value A9 HEX.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.GetQuotedPrintableByteArray(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes Quoted-printable to byte array. Changes 3 chars '=A9' into one byte with value A9 HEX. If 'convertUnderScore' is set to true changes '_' into space ' ' (20 HEX).
member.param: if true converts underscore ('_') into space (' ')

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.GetBase64ByteArray(System.String)
member.summary: Changes Base64 string to byte array.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.GetEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Returns Encoding for passed charset. If charset is not supported return default Encoding.
member.returns: Encoding for charset or default encoding.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.DecodeQuotedPrintable(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Decodes Quoted-printable string.
member.param: if true converts underscore ('_') into space (' ')
member.exception: The charset is not supported by the current regional options of the computer executing this method

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.DecodeBase64(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Decodes Base64 string
member.exception: The charset is not supported by the current regional options of the computer executing this method

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.EncodeBase64(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Encodes string into Base64 form
member.exception: The charset is not supported by the current regional options of the computer executing this method.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.EncodeBase64(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Encodes string into Base64 form.
member.exception: The charset is not supported by the current regional options of the computer executing this method.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.EncodeBase64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes byte array in to Base64 string.
member.param: Maximum length of each line. -1=no limit.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.EncodeBase64(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes byte array in to Base64 string.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.StringCoding.Coding.Encode(System.Byte[],Lesnikowski.StringCoding.MimeEncoding)
member.summary: For strings "iso-8859-2"

member.name: T:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions
member.summary: This is a simple implementation of IDictionary using a singly linked list (for string values). It is smaller and faster than a Hashtable if the number of elements is 10 or less. This should not be used if performance is important for large numbers of elements.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions.GetHeaderValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets string value under specified string. If it is not present returns null.
member.remarks: Equivalent to: HeaderCoding.Decode(this.Options["key"])

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds option to the collection.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new, empty StringOptions object.

member.name: M:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates new Stringoptions object.
member.param: If true all keys added to collection will be converted to lower case.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions.KeysToLower
member.summary: If set to true all keys added to collection will be converted to lower case.

member.name: P:Lesnikowski.Mail.StringOptions.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or Sets string value under specified string key.
member.returns: value -or- null when key is not present in collection.
